results.title: Ithaca
results.brief_description: A short 3D computer animation depicts a formation of ufos flying amongst the pyramids. A tour of some of the natural land forms around the world, we see mountains form, marbled rock formations and islands over a psychadelic sea. The ufo’s playfully fly amongst the various forms as if celebrating and surveying their creations.

results.title: The Greatest story untold
results.brief_description: A short animation using both 3D claymation and 2D hand-drawn animation. A caveman wanders through the snow back to his cave and family after a hunt to find his family telling their dreams of the future. The stories differ with visions of our contemporary life, aliens kidnapping humans, and battles between good and evil.

results.title: Street kid
results.brief_description: In this short animation using both claymation and computer animation, a street kid is forced to survive in a harsh environment. He hunts through bins for food and is driven by his desperate circumstances to beg. After unsuccessfully begging he returns to the alley and is approached by a man who appears to care but has dubious intentions, pushing drugs onto the young boy.

results.title: Autarky
results.brief_description: An exploration of the possibilities that the intergration of digital technology and the natural world can open up for women. Archetypal feminine symbols and themes suggest that resources for female empowerment and self-sufficency are to be found in the layers beneath the social construction of patriarchy

results.title: Frickenstein
results.brief_description: A crazy scientist and his hapless assistant Egor hatch a giant genetic chicken. Confronted by an angry mob the scientist convinces them that they can profit from such a creation

results.title: Noir
results.brief_description: The collaborative cut-out animation humourously puts a spin on an iconographical film noir scene - the chase. In a dark and deserted building a man (also dark) with his violin and limp follows a lone woman through the floors. Tension builds and eventually the mysterious figure is jumped by the woman who grabs his violin. A fight ensues with the turn throwing of a range of instruments at each other; a violin, tuba, piano all with accompanying foley. No credits provided.

results.title: Metamorphosis: DW
results.brief_description: A colour 2D computer animation in response to the project theme of metamorphosis. The head of a rhinoceros appears and wings then sprout to fly him away. Animator uses both soundtrack and foley in this short animation.

results.title: Metamorphosis
results.brief_description: A colour 2D hand-drawn computer animation in response to the project theme of metamorphosis. A head changes into many things. His hair blows in the wind whilst his nose grows until the head becomes a pumpkin… An all encompassing visual play on the titles meaning. (No credits available).

results.title: Mind of Tibet
results.creator_credit: Geshe Thargye, Sue Ford and Ian Bryson
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
In the late 1990s in Tibet a ceremonial Buddhist teaching festival was conducted. A monk was asked to take a VHS handycam through the crowd, documenting the event so that the undeniable existence of these devout people could be ‘captured’. The tape was to be an enormous family album for exiled Tibetans around the world. But it was also a witnessing document in case any misfortune befell the pilgrims. It was a subtle, pragmatic act of remembrance.

Years later, when Australian artist Sue Ford sat with eminent Buddhist scholar and teacher Geshe Sonam Thargye to view the tapes in Geelong, they felt it was extraordinarily clear that the camera had absorbed something more than a crowd at a festival. They realised that they had the makings of a meditative environment that could bear witness to the compassion that is the subject of so much Buddhist teaching. As they began to assemble the shots, they found that the sequencing of the ceremonies and teachings guided their editing decisions for the installation.

The video footage was composed of all-encompassing loops radiating around the viewer as the monk’s camera traced circle after circle through the crowd, and as the chants and ceremonies of nourishment enfolded the crowd in a compassionate assembly of learning and witnessing. To complete this concentric aesthetic, the artists suggested the array of eight screens as a way of immersing visitors within the crowd of pilgrims. Sitting within the circumambient mandala, visitors to the installation find themselves in the midst of a consciousness that knows how the past, present and future are all folded into each other, in the endlessly remembering ‘Mind of Tibet’.

Geshe Sonam Thargye is an eminent Tibetan lama serving with the Tibetan government in-exile based in Dharamsala, India. He also spends a significant portion of his time teaching in Geelong, Australia. Sue Ford was a Victorian filmmaker and one of Australia’s leading photographic portrait makers.

results.title: Metamorphosis: Fly in the ointment
results.brief_description: A 2D hand-drawn computer animation that responds to the set theme of metamorphosis. A goat-devil transforms into a fly and disappears into a flower pot.
